楛字的基本解释

楛
kǔ
粗劣，不坚固，不精致：楛耘伤岁（不精致的耕作会影响到一年的收成）。

楛
hù
古书上指荆一类的植物，茎可制箭杆。

楛字的汉语字典释义

[①]［hù］
［《廣韻》侯古切，上姥，匣。］
木名，荆属。茎坚韧，可制箭杆及器物。
[②]［kǔ］
［《字彙》孔五切］
(1)器物粗劣不坚。
(2)引申为恶劣，不正当。
(3)通“枯”。枯槁。

楛字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　楛； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页540第03
【唐韻】【正韻】侯古切【集韻】【韻會】後五切，?音戸。【說文】木也。【書·禹貢】惟箘簵楛，三邦底貢厥名。【註】楛中矢榦。【魯語】武王時肅愼氏貢楛矢石砮，長尺有咫。　又【詩·大雅】榛楛濟濟。【陸璣·草木疏】形似荆而赤莖，似蓍。　又凡器物堅好曰功，濫惡曰楛。【荀子·勸學篇】問楛者勿告也，告楛者勿問也，說楛者勿聽也。【註】康五切，音苦。【韻會】果五切。

楛字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
楛字的起名意思

暂无。

broken utensil
Basic explanation of words
broken utensil
kǔ
Coarse, not strong, not delicate: Yun Yun hurts the years (improper farming will affect the year's harvest).
broken utensil
hù
In ancient books, plants like wattle, stems can be used to make arrow shafts.
broken utensil
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［hù］
["Guangyun" Hou Guqie, Shangma, Xie. ]
Wooden name, Vitex. The stem is tough and can be used to make arrow shafts and utensils.
[②]［kǔ］
[Five cuts with holes in "Words"]
(1) The utensils are coarse and not strong.
(2) The extension is bad and improper.
(3) Through "dry". withered.
broken utensil
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　楛; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 540 Page 03
[Tang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Hou Guqi [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] The last five cuts,? Yindo. [Said the text] Mu Ye. 【Book·Yugong】Weizhengong, the tributary name of the three states. [Note] Shunaka Yagan. [Lu language] Shi Sumin, the king of Wu, has a stone pan with a long chi very close at hand.　[Poetry·Daya] There are so many things. 【Lu Ji·Sparse Vegetation】Like a jingle with red stems, like achilles.　Everything that is strong is called gong, and if it is evil, it is called 楛. [Xunzi·Encourage Learning] Those who ask you should not tell, those who tell you should not ask, and those who say you should not listen. [Note] Kang Wuqie, the sound is bitter. 【Rhyme】Fruit five cuts.
broken utensil
